Package community.leaf.textchain.adventure

Class TextChain

java.lang.Object
community.leaf.textchain.adventure.Chain<TextChain>
community.leaf.textchain.adventure.TextChain
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChainedAudienceSender<TextChain>, ComponentLike
public final class TextChain extends Chain<TextChain>
The de facto standard chain, and also a factory: all chains ultimately start here.

As a chain type, it doesn't do anything special or unexpected. Text appended to this chain will remain intact and unprocessed (by using TextProcessor.none(String)).

Think of it as the chain type closest to Adventure's own component builders. It's the vanilla variety, if you will.

    • chain

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C chain​(ChainConstructor<C> constructor, TextComponent.Builder builder)
      Constructs a new chain by wrapping the provided text component builder and supplying it to the constructor. Operations performed on the builder will be reflected in the chain, since the same builder instance will be used internally.
      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      constructor - a standard chain constructor
      builder - an existing text component builder
      Returns:
      a new chain created by the constructor that internally uses the provided builder

    • legacy

      public static LegacyTextChain legacy()
      Creates a new, empty LegacyTextChain instance. This chain will automatically process legacy ampersand-style color codes in text (like "&3&o").
      Returns:
      an empty legacy text chain
      See Also:
      TextProcessor.legacyAmpersand(String)

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C chain​(ChainConstructor<C> constructor, Style style)
      Constructs a new chain by applying the provided style to a new text component builder and supplying it to the constructor. All elements in the chain will inherit the style unless specifically overridden by applying other styles.
      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      constructor - a standard chain constructor
      style - the style to apply on the entire chain
      Returns:
      a new chain created by the constructor with the provided style applied

    • chain

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C chain​(ChainConstructor<C> constructor, ComponentLike componentLike)
      Constructs a new chain by deriving a new text component builder from the provided component-like and supplying it to the constructor. If the component received by ComponentLike.asComponent() is a TextComponent instance, the chain's internal builder will be that component converted directly into a builder via BuildableComponent.toBuilder(). Otherwise, a new text component builder is created and the provided component-like is simply appended to it.
      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      constructor - a standard chain constructor
      componentLike - an existing component-like
      Returns:
      a new chain created by the constructor that internally uses a text component builder derived from the provided component-like

    • chain

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C chain​(ChainSource<C> source, ComponentLike componentLike)
      Constructs a new chain by deriving a new text component builder from the provided component-like and supplying it to the source's constructor. If the component received by ComponentLike.asComponent() is a TextComponent instance, the chain's internal builder will be that component converted directly into a builder via BuildableComponent.toBuilder(). Otherwise, a new text component builder is created and the provided component-like is simply appended to it.
      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      source - a chain source
      componentLike - an existing component-like
      Returns:
      a new chain created by the source's constructor that internally uses a text component builder derived from the provided component-like

Otherwise, a new text component builder is created and the provided component-like is simply appended to it.

    • reset

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C reset​(ChainConstructor<C> constructor)
      Constructs a new chain by supplying the constructor with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style). Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore).

      Note: every element in the chain inherits this "reset" state unless specifically overridden by applying styles.

      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      constructor - a standard chain constructor
      Returns:
      a new "reset" chain created by the constructor
      See Also:
      chain(ChainConstructor, Style), Components.RESET

    • reset

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C reset​(ChainSource<C> source)
      Constructs a new chain by supplying the source's constructor with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style). Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore).

      Note: every element in the chain inherits this "reset" state unless specifically overridden by applying styles.

      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      source - a chain source
      Returns:
      a new "reset" chain created by the source's constructor
      See Also:
      chain(ChainSource, Style), Components.RESET

    • reset

      public static TextChain reset()
      Creates a new TextChain instance with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style). Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore).

      Note: every element in the chain inherits this "reset" state unless specifically overridden by applying styles.

      Returns:
      a new "reset" text chain
      See Also:
      chain(Style), Components.RESET

    • legacyReset

      public static LegacyTextChain legacyReset()
      Creates a new LegacyTextChain instance with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style). Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore).

      Note: every element in the chain inherits this "reset" state unless specifically overridden by applying styles.

      Returns:
      a new "reset" legacy text chain
      See Also:
      legacy(Style), Components.RESET

    • reset

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C reset​(ChainConstructor<C> constructor, @NullOr TextColor color)
      Constructs a new chain by supplying the constructor with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style) with the specified color applied. Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore). However, if the provided color is null, then the color from a parent chain/component will be inherited.

      Note: every element in the chain inherits this "reset" state unless specifically overridden by applying styles.

      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      constructor - a standard chain constructor
      color - the color to apply or null to allow color inheritance
      Returns:
      a new "reset" chain created by the constructor with the color applied
      See Also:
      chain(ChainConstructor, Style), Components.UNFORMATTED

    • reset

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> C reset​(ChainSource<C> source, @NullOr TextColor color)
      Constructs a new chain by supplying the source's constructor with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style) with the specified color applied. Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore). However, if the provided color is null, then the color from a parent chain/component will be inherited.

      Note: every element in the chain inherits this "reset" state unless specifically overridden by applying styles.

      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      source - a chain source
      color - the color to apply or null to allow color inheritance
      Returns:
      a new "reset" chain created by the source's constructor with the color applied
      See Also:
      chain(ChainSource, Style), Components.UNFORMATTED

      Creates a new TextChain instance with a new, explicitly-unformatted text component builder (thus "resetting" its style) with the specified color applied. Use this to avoid inheriting styles from a parent chain/component (especially useful for item lore). However, if the provided color is null, then the color from a parent chain/component will be inherited.

    • wrap

      public static TextChain wrap​(WrappedTextComponentBuilder builder)
      Wraps an existing WrappedTextComponentBuilder instance with a new TextChain.
      Parameters:
      builder - an existing builder
      Returns:
      a new text chain containing the builder

    • wrap

      public static <C extends Chain<C>> TextChain wrap​(C chain)
      Wraps an existing chain with a new TextChain. This is primarily useful for easily converting to the "standard" chain type, as other chain subtypes may not necessarily be adequately supported. This is mainly a defensive measure to make your life easier, just in case.

      Rather than using this method to gain a common chain type everywhere, it's best to first try using proper generics. If all else fails, then by all means, use this (it's intended to be a last resort).

      Type Parameters:
      C - chain type
      Parameters:
      chain - an existing chain
      Returns:
      a new text chain containing the existing chain's internal builder

    • getConstructor

      protected ChainConstructor<TextChain> getConstructor()
      Description copied from class: Chain
      Gets this chain's constructor so more chains of the same type can be created and operated on. If a subtype has more required constructor arguments than just the standard WrappedTextComponentBuilder, simply pass those dependencies along.
      Specified by:
      getConstructor in class Chain<TextChain>
      Returns:
      a valid standard constructor for the chain's type

      Process the input text by converting it from a string into a text component.
      Specified by:
      processText in class Chain<TextChain>
      Parameters:
      text - the input text
      Returns:
      a component generated by processing the input text
